newsitem.title: COMOROS: Comoran PM submits resignation, stays as caretaker.
newsitem.headline: Comoran PM submits resignation, stays as caretaker.

text.p: The prime minister of the Comoro Islands and his cabinet have submitted their resignations to President Mohamed Taki so that Taki can name a new cabinet, officials said on Thursday.
Taki asked the prime minister, Tajiddine Ben Said Massonde, and his cabinet to stay on as caretakers, they added.
The resignation was expected after parliamentary elections in the Indian Ocean islands which ended last week in an overwhelming victory for the ruling party, the National Rally for Development.
The party won 36 of the 43 seats in the federal assembly (parliament) in elections boycotted by the main opposition group. Independents won four seats and an Islamist party three.
Massonde was appointed prime minister in March, shortly after Taki came to power, and he retained his position in a cabinet shuffle in August.
Taki is not expected to name a new cabinet until he returns from a visit to China on December 23, sources close to the presidency said. Taki's visit begins on Thursday.
